portabout.para: NetBSD/prep is the port of NetBSD to early PReP (PowerPC Reference Platform) machines.

portinfo.portml: NetBSD's port to PReP (PowerPC Reference Platform) machines
all of the PowerPC-based NetBSD ports
portinfo.portlinkitem: GXemul, a functional machine emulator which also emulates IBM 6050.

portlinkitem.ulink: Setting up the hardware with System Management Services on 7248

portnews.portnewsitem: Support for the IBM RS/6000 7025 model F40 has been added to the prep port.

portnewsitem.title: IBM 7025-F30 and Motorola Powerstack E1 Support

portnews.portnewsitem: Support for the IBM RS/6000 7025 model F30 and the Motorola Powerstack E1 have been added to the prep port.
Support for the IBM RS/6000 7024 model E20 and E30 has been added to the prep port.
NetBSD 3.0 has been released with support for 57 architectures. More information is available in the 3.0 release announcement.

NetBSD 2.1, the first maintenance release of the netbsd-2 release branch, has been released with binary distributions for 48 architectures. More information is available in the 2.1 release announcement.
NetBSD 2.0 released with support for 48 architectures. More information is available in the 2.0 release announcement.
Platform support was extended to the IBM RS/6000 40P 6015.
NetBSD 1.6.2 released with support for 40 architectures. More information is available in the 1.6.2 release announcement.
NetBSD 1.6.1 released with support for 40 architectures. More information is available in the 1.6.1 release announcement.
NetBSD 1.6 released with support for 39 architectures. More information is available in the 1.6 release announcement.
Platform support was extended to the IBM RS/6000 43P 7043-140.
Userland and kernel snapshot, based on 2002/05/02 sources, is now available in the NetBSD/prep snapshot area of the ftp server.

portnewsitem.title: Motorola Ultra 603 and Ultra Plus support

portnews.portnewsitem: Platform support was extended to the Motorola Ultra 603 and Ultra Plus boards, which are the buildling blocks for systems such as the Bull ESTRELLA 200 series.

portnewsitem.title: Linux compatibility enabled for PowerPC ports

portnews.portnewsitem: &a.manu; has integrated Linux binary compatibility for PowerPC ports. This means that NetBSD/prep should now be able to run LinuxPPC binaries such as Netscape Communicator.

portsection.title: Supported System Models
portsection.para: Currently the following models are supported in NetBSD/prep:

itemizedlist.listitem: Motorola Ultra 603 and Ultra Plus (Bull ESTRELLA 200)
